member.name: T:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor
member.summary: Defines the base class for managing time/usage limited evaluations of products. The and classes provide concrete instances of this class that store the data in the registry and isolated storage respectively.

remarks.para: Instantiate an instance of a derived class to read/write the evaluation parameters for the given product. The is set the first time that the class is instantiated. The and properties are set each time the class is instantiated (or once per day if the property is set to true).

Note that evaluation data must be stored somewhere on the users hard disk. It is therefore not too difficult for a sophisticated user to determine the changes made either to registry keys or files (using file/registry monitoring software) and restore the state of these to their pre-installation state (thus resetting the evaluation period). For this reason it is recommended that you don't rely on this mechanism alone. You should also consider limiting the functionality of your product in some way or adding nag screens to discourage long term use of evaluation versions.

If you have a data oriented application you can increase the security of evaluations by storing the current somewhere in your database each time the application runs and cross checking this with the number returned by the EvaluationMonitor.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the evaluation monitor.
member.param: Should the usage count only be incremented once per day
A unique Id for this product
member.remarks: If countUsageOncePerDay is set to true then the is only incremented once for each day that the product is actually used. If countUsageOncePerDay is false then the is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a product

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor.CountUsageOncePerDay
member.summary: Get whether the should be incremented only once per day
member.remarks: If CountUsageOncePerDay is set to true then the is only incremented once for each day that the product is actually used. If CountUsageOncePerDay is false then the is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a given product id. To change this property set the corresponding parameter in the constructor.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor.UsageCount
member.summary: Return the number of times the product has been used
member.remarks: If is set to true then the UsageCount is only incremented once for each day that the product is actually used. If is false then the UsageCount is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a given product id. Typically you should instantiate an EvaluationMonitor object just once in your software.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor.FirstUseDate
member.summary: Return the date/time the product was first used

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.EvaluationMonitor.LastUseDate
member.summary: Return the date/time the product was last used
member.remarks: If is set to true then this is the date at which the usage count was last updated - otherwise it is the date at which the EvaluationMonitor was last created.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.LicenseUtilities.UseMachineKeyStore
member.summary: Determines whether RSA keys used to verify licenses are stored on a user or machine level
member.remarks: Setting this value to true may be useful when impersonating or running under an account whose user profile is not loaded. ILS will by default use the MachineKeyStore when there is no interactive user (ie services and ASP.NET) otherwise it will use the UserKeyStore.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.LicenseUtilities.Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a checksum string with a maximum length of 3 characters based on the given input string
member.param: The input string to return a checksum for
member.returns: An checksum that can be used to validate the given input string

remarks.para: This function can be used to generate a short checksum that can be embedded in a license key as . This allows you to tie the license key to information supplied by the user (for instance the name of the purchaser) without having to include the full information in the license key. This enables license keys to be kept reasonably short.

When the license is checked by the application it performs a checksum on the information supplied by the user and checks that it matches the information in the ProductInfo that was generated when the license was issued. The License Tracker application provides support for "CustomGenerators" which allow you provide the code to generate the ProductInfo from customer and other information.
The returned string has a maximum length of 3 characters - but may be shorter. If you require a constant length checksum string then consider using the overloaded method that takes a pad parameter.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.LicenseUtilities.Checksum(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a checksum string based on the given input string
member.param: The input string to return a checksum for
The maximum length of the checksum string
If true the checksum is always padded to give a constant length string
member.returns: An checksum that can be used to validate the given input string

remarks.para: This function can be used to generate a short checksum that can be embedded in a license key as . This allows you to tie the license key to information supplied by the user (for instance the name of the purchaser) without having to include the full information in the license key. This enables license keys to be kept reasonably short.

When the license is checked by the application it performs a checksum on the information supplied by the user and checks that it matches the information in the ProductInfo that was generated when the license was issued. The License Tracker application provides support for "CustomGenerators" which allow you provide the code to generate the ProductInfo from customer and other information.

member.name: T:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.RegistryEvaluationMonitor
member.summary: Defines an implementation of the base class that stores the evaluation data in a hidden, encrypted key within the windows registry.

remarks.para: Instantiate an instance of this class to read/write the evaluation parameters for the given product. Note that a sophisticated user could determine the changes made to registry keys (using registry monitoring software) and restore the state of these to their pre-installation state (thus resetting the evaluation period). For this reason it is recommended that you don't rely on this mechanism alone. You should also consider limiting the functionality of your product in some way or adding nag screens to discourage long term use of evaluation versions.

If you have a data oriented application you can increase the security of evaluations by storing the current somewhere in your database each time the application runs and cross checking this with the number returned by the EvaluationMonitor.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.RegistryEvaluationMonitor.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the evaluation monitor.
member.param: Should the usage count only be incremented once per day
A unique password for this product
If true then any exceptions thrown while reading or creating the evaluation data are caught and ignored
member.remarks: If countUsageOncePerDay is set to true then the is only incremented once for each day that the product is actually used. If countUsageOncePerDay is false then the is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a product

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.ASP.RegistryEvaluationMonitor.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the evaluation monitor.
member.param: A unique password for this product
member.remarks: Same as calling RegistryEvaluationMonitor(password, false, true)

member.summary: Gets or sets the current position in the underlying stream.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the underlying stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count- 1) replaced by the bytes read from the underlying source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the underlying stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the underlying stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the underlying stream.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the underlying stream.
member.param: The desired length of the underlying stream in bytes.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the underlying stream and advances the current position within the stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the underlying stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the underlying stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the underlying stream.

member.name: M:MiscUtil.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.
